history.content:
Hello- our CS Scheduler is OOO until tomorrow, but this is from the "Getting into CS Classes" page: 

Any EECS major or undeclared COE student may enroll directly into these classes provided there is space. Undeclared L&S students who are first or second year undergraduates will also be able to enroll directly into these classes; third year undergraduates who are undeclared L&S students would be treated similarly for Fall semester classes only and then only for CS 61C and CS 70. Other students will be able to place themselves on the waitlist.

Transfer students —as well as first or second year undergraduates who have received community college units while in high school— who have difficulty enrolling should contact cs-scheduling@eecs.berkeley.edu.

You can't enroll in the class if you're not able to enroll in all sections. You would need to pick an open lab.

Also, it is in your interest to make any changes today as starting tomorrow, the waitlists for CS61ABC/70 will all be processed in order with no preferences given to EECS or undeclared L&S majors.

I am a freshman intended CS, but when I enrolled into a full lab section for 61A I got waitlisted. If I reenroll into an open lab section will I automatically enroll directly into the course? Or will I be put on the waitlist again and possibly worsen my chances of getting in?
history.subject: 61A Waitlist
